translator_notes: Chapter 77 describes the tragic death of Qingwen (俏丫鬟) and the departure of the actress troupe (美优伶)
Chapter 78 contains the famous '芙蓉女儿诔' (Elegy for the Hibiscus Spirit), Baoyu's eulogy for Qingwen
'河东狮' (Lion from East of the River) is a classical allusion meaning 'shrew' or domineering wife
'中山狼' (Wolf of Zhongshan) is an allusion from a Yuan dynasty story about an ungrateful person who harms their benefactor - referring to Sun Shaozu who mistreats Yingchun
Chapters 79-80 share the same title because they were originally one chapter
The appendices contain valuable scholarly materials on manuscript sources and commentary traditions
The 靖藏本 (Jing Collection) was a lost manuscript whose commentaries were partially preserved by Mao Guoyao
research_notes: This is the final page of the table of contents, covering chapters 75-80 (the last chapters of Cao Xueqin's original text)
Chapter 80 marks the end of the authenticated Cao Xueqin text; the following 40 chapters in the 120-chapter edition are attributed to Gao E
The appendices provide essential scholarly apparatus for understanding the textual history of the novel
